Learn fun cooking tips at one of our LIVE Taste of Home Cooking School events! Here's one from Dana  Elliott (Taste of Home Culinary Specialist) for grilling season.

Before grilling or smoking your ribs:
1) Wipe down your rack with a dry paper towel for easier handling. 
2) Take a very sharp knife, and make just a small incision down the side of each bone. This separates the membrane, and allows the ribs to easily separate after they have cooked.

status_message: "The first time I made these cookies, I sent them to my stepson in the Marines. The next time he phoned, guess what he requested? More of these cookies!" —Marcella Moore, Washburn, Illinois

"I didn't see my son, Lance Corporal Eric Harris, for more than two years after he enlisted in the Marines after high school. And when I saw him for the first time at the airport last fall, I just grabbed hold of him and busted out crying. When we got home, the first thing he ate was two bowls of my banana pudding. He's a true Southern boy! It's a dessert, but you can have it for breakfast, lunch or dinner."  —Stephanie Harris, Montpelier, Virginia

"My husband was in the Air Force so we've entertained guests in many parts of the world. I acquired this recipe while in California. It's one of my favorite special appetizers." —Sandra J. Twait, Tampa, Florida

"I also call this 'My Grandson's Mac & Cheese.' Zachary has been to Iraq and Afghanistan with both the Marines and Navy, and I've been privileged to make his favorite casserole for him for over 20 years." —Alice Beardsell, Osprey, Florida

"My kids love making these home-style cookies. They're so wonderful when warm." —Jaye Beeler, Grand Rapids, Michigan

"I developed this recipe for a friend who wanted a potato salad without mayonnaise. I have substituted fresh thyme for the basil. Any fresh herbs would be great!" —Melanie Cloyd, Mullica Hill, New Jersey
"We live in Coca-Cola country, where everyone loves a chocolatey, moist sheet cake made with the iconic soft drink. Our rich version does the tradition proud." —Heidi Jobe, Carrollton, Georgia

"I do not usually like meat loaf, but my family and I can't get enough of these little muffins topped with a sweet ketchup sauce. This recipe requires no chopping, so it's quick and easy to make a double batch and have extras for another day. They're great to give to new moms, too." —Joyce Wegmann, Burlington, Iowa
"This tangy, hearty salad is a refreshing dish to serve at a picnic. Mild spices blend nicely with the beans and garden ingredients." —Linda Ault, Newberry, Indiana

"The garlic and lemon are great together on this breaded chicken. I've served this several times for special-occasion dinners." —Janice Steinmetz, Somers, Connecticut
"While cinnamon bread is a natural for breakfast, we love it so much we enjoy it all day long." —Helen Richardson, Shelbyville, Michigan

"Once school starts, it can be hard for kids to let go of summer. But these rich, gooey, great-tasting bars will bring back sweet campfire memories—and smiles—whether they're served for dessert or as an after-school snack." —Lisa DiPrima, Wilton, New Hampshire

"I've been making this mild family-pleasing casserole for years. It tastes wonderful, fits nicely into our budget and, best of all, makes a second one to freeze and enjoy later." —Joan Hallford, North Richland Hills, Texas
"Dress up an all-time favorite comfort food with savory fixings. This is an easy recipe that delivers big flavor." —Anna Mayer, Fort Branch, Indiana

"If you love spicy wings, you'll love this dip. It's super cheesy, full of rich flavor and really has the taste of buffalo wings!" —Taste of Home Test Kitchen

"I'm a big fan of dulce de leche and am always looking for a way to incorporate it into sweet dishes. I decided to make a breakfast dish that was reminiscent of a luscious dulce de leche cheesecake. The pecan topping takes the dish over the top without making it overly sweet." —Anna Stigger, Katy, Texas

status_message: "This cake reminds me of my grandmother, because it was one of her specialties. I bake it often for family parties, and it always brings back fond memories." —Patricia Kreitz, Richland, Pennsylvania

"I made this creamy pasta casserole out of ingredients I had on hand. I took the dish for another flavorful spin and added a bit of smoky bacon and toasted bread crumbs." —Nikki Barton, Providence, Utah

"This recipe is one of my family's favorites. The chowder is chock-full of potatoes, ham and carrots. I like to make this comforting soup at least once or twice a month during the fall and winter." —Jennifer Trenhaile, Emerson, Nebraska

status_message: "Tomatoes and green chilies give color and zip to this very cheesy egg bake. It makes a hearty breakfast or brunch entree." —Mary Steiner, West Bend, Wisconsin

"This is a variation on a lasagna dish a coworker made for a company potluck. When I was expecting our third son, I often prepared meals and froze them. It was so nice to have a substantial entree like this one to bake." —Colleen Wolfisberg, Everson, Washington

"I needed a fast supper while babysitting my grandchild. I used what my daughter-in-law had in the fridge and turned it into what's now one of our favorite recipes." —Sandra Ellis, Stockbridge, Georgia
"A delightful coconut and ricotta cheese filling is hidden inside these chocolate cupcakes." —Dolores Skrout, Summerhill, Pennsylvania

You'll never waste brown sugar again! Use soft brown sugar to make showstopping pies. Learn all the secrets and tips—from roll-out to cool-down—in the American as Pie class from the Taste of Home Online Cooking School.
"Pepperoni, tomatoes and olives dress up this cheesy baked dip. I serve it with breadsticks and wedges of baked Boboli." —Kitti Boesel, Woodbridge, Virginia
"My son joked about adding bacon to cupcakes. I made bacon cups the next morning. The look on his face was priceless." — Karen Burkett, Reseda, California
"This cake is filled with fresh peaches, toasted pecans and roasted cinnamon and ground ginger—and that makes it different." —Jeanette Nelson, Sophia, West Virginia

"These traditional pork chops have a wonderful home-cooked flavor like the ones Mom used to make. The breading makes them crispy outside and tender and juicy inside." —Deborah Amrine, Grand Haven, Michigan

"Nothing beats the flavor of grilled vegetables, and this is a super way to use your garden bounty. I grill the veggies anytime I'm grilling something else, then whip up the salsa and put it in the fridge to marinate. It's even better the next day." —Teri Kman Laporte, Colorado

"Even as a young girl, I was always going through recipe books in search of something new to make. That's how I came across these brownies, a favorite for our family reunions and other get-togethers. They capture the rich flavor of a favorite cake with a few easy steps." —Karen Grimes, Stephens City, Virginia

"My husband and I thought the original skillet dish lacked pizzazz, so we created this tastier version. I've had teenage nieces and nephews request the recipe after their first bite." —Joyce Whipps, West Des Moines, Iowa
"Each one of the fun fillings you can put in these soft rolls are packed with cinnamon flavor. And they're definitely worth the wait overnight." —Chris O'Connell, San Antonio, Texas
"Everyone who tries this dessert falls in love with it." —Latona Dwyer, Palm Beach Gardens, Florida
"I take this dish to many of my family's picnics because it's such a hit. Serve it at any time of day. Of course, it's always a tasty addition to brunch." —Edie DeSpain, Logan, Utah
"This artful interpretation of layered comfort food—with a twist—is what we like to call 'casser-roll.'" —Kali Wraspir, Olympia, Washington
It's National Toasted Marshmallow Day! Make s'mores to celebrate.
"When I don't have much time to cook supper, slow cooker chicken fajitas are a flavorful way to keep my family full and satisfied." —Michele Furry, Plains, Montana

"My muffins are a frequent request from everyone in the family. I usually make them on Sunday nights, so when we're running late on weekday mornings, the kids can grab these to eat on the bus." —Irene Wayman, Grantsville, Utah
"For a 'picnic perfect' dessert, this moist delicious cake travels and slices very well. With chocolate chips, walnuts and raisins, it's a real crowd pleaser." —Marian Platt, Sequim, Washington
"With a tomato-y meat sauce and tangy goat cheese, this weeknight wonder is my version of comfort food." —Lizzie Munro, Brooklyn, New York

"These golden brown rolls are light, tender and easy to make. To cut out the biscuits, we use the top of a drinking glass, and they turn out just fine. I like them warm with lots of butter." —Emma Rea, Columbia, South Carolina
"As a retired home economics teacher, I've made quite a few recipes through the years. This hearty casserole in a favorite of my family." —Dorothy Erickson, Blue Eye, Missouri

"When I take these rich brownies to any get-together, I carry the recipe, too, because it always gets requested. This special treat is typically the first to be gone from the buffet table—even before the entrees!" —Wendy Bailey, Elida, Ohio
"I found the recipe for this hearty stovetop dish several years ago and changed it to fit our tastes. It was an instant hit." —Marilyn Hash, Enumclaw, Washington
"The tangy lemon flavor of this no-fuss bar dessert is especially delicious on a warm day. It reminds me of selling lemonade on the sidewalk as a little girl." —Donna Biddle, Elmira, New York
"Crispy, juicy and perfectly seasoned, this fried chicken lives up to its name. Family reunions and neighborly gatherings will never be the same." —Lola Clifton, Vinton, Virginia

"This recipe looks like you fussed, but it's a snap to prepare. Lemon and herbs enhance the shrimp, and bread crumbs add a pleasing crunch. Served over pasta, this main dish is pretty enough for company." —Lori Packer, Omaha, Nebraska
"These cookies are more cake-like; a nice change from the more common chewier chocolate chip cookie." —Lauren Reiff, East Earl, Pennsylvania

"This hearty, crowd-pleasing dish is a comforting meal on a chilly night with bread and a salad. It also makes a delicious side dish. It doesn't take long to make but tastes like it simmered all day." —Jolene Lopez, Wichita, Kansas

"This bread has won many ribbons at our fall fair. The recipe yields two nicely spiced loaves—one for eating and one for sharing. I like to make it for family and friends." —Chantelle Ross, Forest Grove, British Columbia

"This cobbler is my surprise dessert. No one ever guesses that the 'secret ingredient' is zucchini. It's great to make for a potluck supper or to serve a crowd. The recipe has been requested time and again in my house, and I'm always happy to make it." —Joanne Fazio, Carbondale, Pennsylvania

"For a big hearty meal, I make this recipe as a side dish to go with veal cutlets or a roast. But you could also serve the beefy lasagna as a main dish. Just pair it with a tossed green salad and loaf of garlic bread." —Patricia Collins, Imbler, Oregon

"Fix and freeze these moist little meat loaves packed with pizza flavor. They're great to reheat for an after-school snack or quick dinner on soccer night. My family likes to drizzle extra pizza sauce on top." —Susan Wollin, Marshall, Wisconsin
"My children have always loved root beer floats, so I came up with this fudgy treat just for them. It's always a best seller at school bake sales." —Jennifer Fisher, Austin, Texas
"My family loves artichoke spinach dip, so I thought I could turn this popular appetizer into a chicken entree. The sourdough bowl makes a fun presentation." —Merry Graham, Newhall, California
"My 13-year-old daughter and her friends asked for French toast at a sleepover, but we were out of bread. I used muffins instead, and they loved it." —Bonnie Geavaras-Bootz, Scottsdale, Arizona
"This rich dessert is my own creation, and I'm very proud of it. It's easy enough to make on weeknights but special enough to serve guests or take to a potluck." —Kathy Specht, Clinton, Montana
"Originally a vegetable dish, I added pasta to this salad for family gatherings and church potlucks." —Barbara Burks, Huntsville, Alabama

"This recipe is such a hit it's traveled all over the country! My mother originated the recipe in Pennsylvania, I brought it to Texas when I married, I'm still making it in California, and my daughter treats her friends to this 'oldie' in Colorado." —Helen Carmichall, Santee, California
"I received this recipe through a friend at a weight loss group. I make at least 8 batches of the salsa every year. It's truly a hit with family and friends!" —Cheryl Jacobsen, Warburg, Alberta

Find tips just like this in our Online Cooking School! In the All About Breads & Rolls class, learn how to make 20 of our most popular bread recipes using different techniques, from savory breads to sweet rolls.
"This delightful cobbler smells so good in the oven, your mouth will be watering just from the aroma during baking. Believe me—there will be no leftovers!" —Roni Goodell, Spanish Fork, Utah
"When my tomatoes ripen, the first things I make are BLTs and this homemade spaghetti sauce." —Sondra Bergy, Lowell, Michigan
"These taste like my favorite coffee house drink in cookie form." —Angela Spengler, Mechanicsburg, Pennsylvania

"I actually invented this recipe at a campground, so you know it's easy. Using the same marinade for the chicken and veggies keeps it simple so we can spend more time outside and less time making dinner." —Jayme Schertz, Clintonville, Wisconsin
"When we get together with friends, I like to prepare this creamy spinach dip. It's a real crowd pleaser." —Janelle Lee, Appleton, Wisconsin
link_name: Spinach Dip in a Bread Bowl

status_message: Are you on Instagram? We are! Follow us for recipe ideas served up in your Instagram feed.
Happy Banana Split Day!

"My sister-in-law always made this delicious breakfast dish when we were camping. One-dish casseroles like this were a big help while I was raising my nine children. Now I've passed this recipe on to them." —Pauletta Bushnell, Albany, Oregon
"For me, the ideal dessert combines the flavors of chocolate and peanut butter. So when I came up with this rich treat, it quickly became my all-time favorite." —Debbie Price, LaRue, Ohio

"A friend served this salad, and I just had to get the recipe. My husband loves BLT sandwiches, so this has become a favorite of his. It's nice to serve on hot and humid days, which we frequently get during summer here in Virginia." —Mrs. Hamilton Myers Jr., Charlottesville, Virginia
"I belong to a cooking club, so I try a lot of new recipes. This one has become one of my favorites. I hope your family enjoys it as much as mine does!" —Netty Dyck, St. Catharines, Ontario

Happy Peach Pie Day! Celebrate with this recipe from Jean Boelsma in Bethel, Maine: "I came up with this recipe when we had a bumper crop of raspberries, and a friend gave me some of the juiciest peaches we'd ever tasted."
"Pizza, egg pockets, stromboli—this make-ahead dough has endless potential for quick and impressive breakfasts, lunches or dinners." —Taste of Home Test Kitchen
"These finger-licking good delicacies are so light and luscious, my family has always called them 'angel food doughnuts.'" —Darlene Brenden, Salem, Oregon

"Mom always made this special cake for my birthday meal. It's very moist and has a nice, light chocolate taste, and the flavorful frosting is the perfect topping." —Deborah Amrine, Grand Haven, Michigan
"As a busy wife and mother of two young sons, I rely on this handy recipe. I layer enchilada ingredients in the slow cooker, turn it on and forget about it." —Mary Luebbert, Benton, Kansas
"This quick recipe is a healthy all-in-one meal. I just add a tossed salad for a menu the entire family loves!" —Nancy Brown, Dahinda, Illinois
"Packed with dates and pecans, we enjoy this moist sweet bread for after-school and late-night snacks." —Carole Resnick, Cleveland, Ohio

"It's not uncommon for folks to go back for second helpings of this hearty main dish when I share it at church potluck suppers. The combination of ground beef, noodles, cheese and a zippy tomato sauce is a crowd-pleaser." —Katherine Moss, Gaffney, South Carolina

"I make this recipe for almost any occasion—it's popular with company and at potluck dinners, and I've passed it around to many friends. My husband and I grow lots of squash in the summer, all for this quiche!" —Dorothy Collins, Winnsboro, Texas
"These sweet peanut butter bars are perfect for breakfast, dessert or an anytime snack. You can add raisins instead of chocolate chips if you prefer." —Helen Velichko, Kansas City, Missouri

"Get a load of this: sour cream, bacon, shredded cheddar, green onions and more come together to give you all the richness of restaurant potato skins at your next picnic." —Monique Boulanger, Greenwood, Nova Scotia
"Serve this recipe whenever you've got a crowd to please!" —Judy Chandler, Franklin, Kentucky
"Simple and flavorful, this recipe is a tasty and healthy way to use up all those zucchini that are taking over your garden." —Bobby Taylor, Ulster Park, New York
"These pinwheels will go quick at your buffet. People will be asking for the recipe!" —Taste of Home Test Kitchen
"This recipe is really just a glorified Monkey Bread. I also make it with garlic and cheese for dinner sometimes." —Lois Rutherford, Elkton, Florida
"In late summer when plums are in season, this tender fruit-topped cake is delectable! The plum slices look so appealing arranged in circles on top." —Anna Daley, Montague, Prince Edward Island
"Folks go back for seconds of this casserole with its down-home flavor, rich sauce and golden topping. I always bring home an empty dish." —Ruth Andrewson, Leavenworth, Washington
"This recipe was given to us by our daughter. My husband and I love it. Because it's made in a slow cooker, it's great for parties or busy days." —Lang Secrest, Sierra Vista, Arizona

"With a lemon filling and chocolate coating, these buttery sandwich cookies are often requested at my house, particularly for special occasions." —Jane Delahoyde, Poughkeepsie, New York

"Some people call it dinner hour, but many of us call it rush hour. Slow down the pace with this super-quick mouthwatering meal. The only thing you'll have left over is time to share with your family at the table." —Brigitte Schaller, Flemington, Missouri
"My family absolutely loves these pancakes. I make them every Saturday and Sunday. If I don't, they don't believe it's the weekend!" —Sharon W. Bickett, Chester, South Carolina
"My mother made this cake for me and my brothers during our childhood. It's excellent any time of the year for potlucks or picnics." —Edie DeSpain, Logan, Utah

"My grandmother often made this casserole when I was young. I forgot about it until I found myself one day adding the same ingredients to leftover rice. The memories came flooding back, and I've made this recipe regularly since then." —Lorna Moore, Glendora, California

"My kids love these beef rolls so much that I always make extra since they heat up so quickly. I give them their choice of dipping sauces—spaghetti sauce or ranch dressing are the top picks." —Kimberly Farmer, Wichita, Kansas

"You won't want to frost these brownies, since the marbled top is too pretty to cover up. Besides, the tasty cream cheese layer makes them taste like they're already frosted." —Darlene Brenden, Salem, Oregon
"Italian sausage and feta cheese give zest to the rice filling in these tender peppers I've prepared often over the years." —Judy Earl, Sarasota, Florida
"Since apples and zucchini are so abundant in this area, it's only natural that the two be used together in one recipe." —Patti Dillingham, Scranton, Arkansas
"These bite-size bonbons may sound tricky to make, but you'll find that fashioning them is a breeze." —Taste of Home Test Kitchen
"My fresh tomato tart is perfect when you want a taste of summer any time of year." —Moji Dabney, Egg Harbor Township, New Jersey
"It takes me just minutes to prepare this recipe and the slow cooker does the rest of the work." —Roxanne Chan, Albany, California

"I've always had to be creative when getting my family to eat vegetables, so I decided to make stuffed zucchini using the pizza flavors that everyone loves. It worked!" —Donna Marie Ryan, Topsfield, Massachusetts
"Canning isn't necessary for these crisp-tender, tangy pickles. Keep them in the fridge and eat them up within a month." —Linda Chapman, Meriden, Iowa
"Baked French toast becomes light and lovely company fare when you fill it with blueberries and top it with an orangey sweet sauce." — Myrna Koldenhoven, Sanborn, Iowa

"My mother insisted that my grandmother write down one recipe for her when she got married in 1942. That was a real effort because Grandma was a traditional pioneer-type cook who used 'a little of this or that 'til it feels right.' This treasured recipe is the only one she ever wrote down!" —Janet Hall, Clinton, Wisconsin

"When I was living in California, I tasted this rich, cheesy pasta dish at a neighborhood Italian restaurant. I got the recipe and made a few changes to it in my own kitchen. I'm happy to share it with you." —Lori Mecca, Grants Pass, Oregon
"This is a family favorite handed down from my dear aunt. And my family has always enjoyed the idea of having pie for supper!" —Eloise Swisher, Roseville, Illinois
"With peach orchards just a couple of miles from home, it's easy to treat my family to this traditional dessert." —Mattie Carter, Rock Hill, South Carolina
"Whole wheat pasta tossed with tomatoes, corn, red peppers, green onions and a little feta is a sure-fire winner." —Angela Spengler, Clovis, New Mexico
Mix up your Taco Tuesday menu with recipes you'll want to make every night of the week! From traditional tacos and fajitas to taco dips and casseroles, find a new favorite way to get your taco fix.

status_message: "While visiting a Wisconsin apple orchard bakery, I tried this tempting treat. At home, I put together the recipe. As it bakes, the enticing aroma fills my kitchen, and friends and family linger waiting for a sample." —Nancy Preussner, Delhi, Iowa
"These colorful little drop biscuits are very easy to put together and yet are packed full of flavor." —Keith Mesch, Mt. Healthy, Ohio

"My best friend and I created this recipe together because we wanted a meal that's easy to prepare, affordable and nutritious. We both have hectic schedules, so when we're feeling crunched for time, it's a relief to have these wholesome enchiladas waiting for us in the freezer." —Holly Baber, Seattle, Washington

"This colorful side dish is sure to please. The spinach and tomato, combined with the Parmesan cheese, give it a fabulous fresh flavor. My daughter especially loves this dish, which I make often." —Ila Mae Alderman, Galax, Virginia
This classic dessert from our friends at Eagle Brand® comes together in just 15 minutes.
"With its beautiful color and intense watermelon flavor, this jelly preserves summer to enjoy long after the cool weather arrives." —Taste of Home Test Kitchen
"This bubbling cherry cobbler is one of my favorite dishes."  —Melissa Wagner, Eden Prairie, Minnesota

"Great for summer, this tasty appetizer is a must-have on weekend family gatherings at our cottage on Sandusky Bay. It's well worth the time it takes to grill the corn and cut it from the cob." —Cathy Myers, Monroeville, Ohio

"I enjoy making this dish for family and friends. It's easy to prepare, and I like to get creative with the sauce. For example, sometimes I might add my home-canned tomatoes, mushrooms or vegetables." —Elaine Anderson Aliquippa, Pennsylvania
"This basic buttery frosting has unmatchable homemade taste. With a few simple variations, you can come up with different colors and flavors." —Diana Wilson, Denver, Colorado
"These wings are an appealing appetizer, but also a favorite for Sunday lunch with rice and a salad." —Joan Airey, Rivers, Manitoba
"My family eats these all the time, and the pancakes don't even taste like they're full of fresh veggies. We especially like the cheese mixed in." —Peggy Roos, Minneapolis, Minnesota
"This easy dessert comes out of the slow cooker warm, moist, fudgy and wonderful. And it won't heat up the kitchen." —Elaine Sweet, Dallas, Texas
"With four small children at home, I need quick yet filling meals. These fast family-favorite sandwiches and are a cinch to make." —Leticia Lewis, Kennewick, Washington
"This vegetable soup is filled with zucchini, green beans, celery and potato, but it's the turmeric that gives it a tasty new twist." —Edith Ruth Muldoon, Baldwin, New York
Happy Lemon Meringue Pie Day!
"Our summer-perfect pasta features baby spinach, cherry tomatoes and crisp bacon tossed with a tangy balsamic vinaigrette." —Taste of Home Test Kitchen
The perfect weekend brunch recipe.

"When asked to bring a dessert for my boys' football team to share, I whipped up these unique blondies and was instantly named 'the greatest mom' by all. Wrap them up creatively to make super festive." —Valonda Seward, Coarsegold, California
"In this recipe, ripe garden ingredients and subtle seasonings make a mouthwatering salsa that's a real summer treat." —Michelle Beran, Caflin, Kansas

"Mom made this scrumptious main dish frequently when I was growing up. When I first met my husband, he wasn't fond of meat loaf. This is the first meal I prepared for him, and now he requests it often." —Michelle Beran, Claflin, Kansas
A new way to use your garden's abundance of zucchini.
Pepperoni, cheese and more favorite pizza toppings fill this top-rated pasta salad.

"While my jam won a first-place ribbon at our local county fair, that may not be the highest compliment it's received. Two girlfriends that I share it with tell me that if they don't hide the jam from their husbands and children, they'll devour an entire jarful at just a sitting!" —Patricia Larsen, Leslieville, Alberta

"Want a quick treat that's delicious and easy to do? These tartlets will do the trick. You can serve them right away, but they're better after chilling for about an hour in the refrigerator." —Ashley Eagon, Kettering, Ohio
"With chunks of fresh zucchini, this is a nice change of pace from typical spaghetti dishes." —Beth Coffee, Hartford City, Indiana
"The tangy flavors and crunch of this eye-appealing side complement any special meal or potluck." —Megan Spencer, Farmington Hills, Michigan

"Good any time of the year, cupcakes make a great get-up-and-go treat on busy summer days. These have been a frosted favorite with family and friends for at least 35 years." —Ellen Moore, Springfield, New Hampshire
"Tender shrimp, fresh spinach and minced basil combine with tangy lemon and feta cheese to give this wonderful pasta toss a unique flavor." —Heidi Farnworth, Riverton, Utah

"Tangy barbecue sauce, fluffy biscuits and cheddar cheese combine to make these hearty muffins. Try them with ground turkey or other shredded cheeses to vary the flavor." —Karen Kenney, Harvard, Illinois

"The first time I served this cheesecake, my friends all went wild over it. The pairing of sweet and salty, creamy and crunchy, plus peanut butter and chocolate, left everyone asking for another slice." —Lois Brooks, Newark, Delaware
"These potatoes are tender and good all by themselves, but pairing them with the sauce creates a perfect combination." —Craig Carpenter, Coraopolis, Pennsylvania

status_message: "I've brought this hot dish to potlucks and it received rave reviews. There's never a crumb left. Best of all, it's a simple, healthy and hearty supper made with easy to find ingredients." —Anne Taglienti, Kennett Square, Pennsylvania
"Grandma Wruble always had a batch of these cookies in the cookie jar and another roll in the refrigerator ready to slice and bake." —Kristi Gleason, Flower Mound, Texas
"These burgers feature great Italian flavor. And who can resist their gooey, cheesy centers or the scrumptious topping?" —Virginia Kochis, Springfield, Virginia
link_name: Basil Burgers with Sun-Dried Tomato Mayonnaise

status_message: "My neighbor shared more zucchini from his garden than I knew what to do with. He loved this recipe." —Darcy Kennedy, Hendersonvlle, North Carolina

"There's something for everyone in these delectable bars, from coconut and chocolate chips to walnuts and toffee. They're popular with kids and adults alike, so make a big batch." —Judith Strohmeyer, Albrightsville, Pennsylvania
"An abundance of squash from my garden inspired me to make up this Stuffed Zucchini recipe, which is now a favorite." —Marjorie Roberts, West Chazy, New York
"This crunchy, savory side dish, a Norwegian favorite, was a staple at all of our family holidays." —Patty LaNoue Stearns, Traverse City, Michigan
"You won't believe something this easy could taste so fantastic! These mozzarella sticks are a treat all ages will love. Kids could help wrap them, too." —Shirley Warren, Thiensville, Wisconsin
"This savory canned sauce is a tomato-grower's dream come true! Use up your garden bounty and enjoy it later in the year." —Tonya Branham, Mt. Olive, Alabama

"My kids love sausage and pancakes but making them during the week was out of the question. I purchased the frozen variety on a stick but didn't like the calories, additives or price. This version of pigs-in-a-blanket is a great alternative that's much more cost effective." —Lisa Dodd, Greenville, South Carolina

"It never occurred to me that I could bake a cobbler in my slow cooker until I saw some recipes and decided to try my favorite fruity dessert recipe. It took a bit of experimenting, but the tasty results are 'berry' well worth it." —Martha Creveling, Orlando, Florida
"Hide this salad until serving time, or you might be surprised to find it gone! Try adding kalamata olives, peppers or yellow tomatoes. Be creative." —Angela Leinenbach, Mechanicsville, Virginia
"Fresh basil gets all the respect in this super supper—even forks will stand at attention when it hits the table." —Judy Armstrong, Prairieville, Louisiana

Happy #NationalSmoresDay! Taste of Home and Girl Scouts USA are celebrating the best way we know how—by making s'mores! Share your S'mores Lore with us throughout the day with your pictures and stories. Use the hashtags #NationalSmoresDay #TasteofHome #GirlScoutsUSA

"My mom stuffs soft homemade yeast rolls with ground beef, tomato sauce and cheese to make these tasty sandwiches. My son takes the leftovers in his lunch the next day." —Nancy Holland, Morgan Hill, California
"Shredded zucchini adds moistness to these tender muffins dotted with raisins and chopped walnuts." —Harriet Stichter, Milford, Indiana

"A cool, creamy version of the original, this delicious dessert is the perfect finish to a satisfying summer meal. Its crumbly topping and smooth apple filling are crowd-pleasers!" —Sharon Bickett, Chester, South Carolina

"Brighten a picnic lunch or backyard barbecue with this cheerful, fresh-tasting salad. If you use want to use sweet corn off the cob, saute the corn for 5 minutes in a skillet before adding to the salad." —Taste of Home Test Kitchen

"My husband is a self-proclaimed mac-and-cheese connoisseur and says that this is his favorite version. The Italian seasoning and tomatoes really complement the pasta and cheeses." —Adriane Mummert, Lancaster, Pennsylvania

Tomorrow is #NationalSmoresDay! Taste of Home has joined with Girl Scouts USA to celebrate one of our favorite treats with all past and present Girl Scouts, as well as s'mores lovers everywhere! We hope you're getting your graham crackers, marshmallows and chocolate ready!

We've all heard of stuffing, grilling or adding zucchini to salads and side dishes. But did you know that you can also bake cakes, cookies and muffins with the garden favorite? Get creative with this summer vegetable by making everything from pizza crust to jams and jellies.
link_name: 23 Recipes You Didn't Know You Could Make with Zucchini

status_message: "I like that this fruit spread is low in sugar and not overly sweet, which lets the fresh peach flavor shine right through." —Rebecca Baird, Salt Lake City, Utah

"My family adores sweets, and I like to serve treats like this that are good for them, too. The cake is spiced just right and the marshmallow topping is spiked with orange juice and vanilla." —Layla Payton, Midwest City, Oklahoma

"Here's a fantastic way to deliver all that blazing jalapeno popper taste without the work. Whenever I bring this dip to a party, I'm always asked for the recipe." —Jennifer Wilke, Collinsville, Illinois
"I start this barbecued pork chop recipe in the morning in the slow cooker and enjoy a tasty supper later without any last-minute work." —Jacqueline Jones, Round Lake Beach, Illinois

Did you know that the s'mores recipe is credited to Loretta Scott Crew, who reportedly made them by the campfire for the Girl Scouts? We're so happy we get to celebrate #NationalSmoresDay with Girl Scouts USA!

We're excited about the state fair here in Wisconsin this week, and especially for the cream puffs—a fair staple since 1924! We're sharing that recipe, plus more ideas for classic fair food and reader's blue-ribbon recipes.

What's the best food found at your state fair?

"My son and I like to make this breakfast favorite together. You can leave the berries out of the mix and sprinkle them on top, or sub in chocolate chips or nuts instead." —Elizabeth Stewart, Crab Orchard, West Virginia
"A homemade cherry filling peeks out from a star-shaped pastry top. You can try different shapes for other occasions and also add almond extract for another flavor." —Taste of Home Test Kitchen
"This savory staple is a wonderful way to accentuate summer's abundance of tomatoes from the garden or farm stand." —Edie DeSpain, Logan, Utah
Happy #InternationalBeerDay! Celebrate by having your beer and eating it, too, in this cheesy dip recipe from Angela Spengler in Mechanicsburg, Pennsylvania.
Taste of Home has another Girl Scout cookie inspired s'mores recipe for you in preparation for #NationalSmoresDay in 3 days! How many can you eat before there's no s'more?
Bring a real taste of summer to your table with these fresh peach recipes, from down-home desserts to breakfasts, main dishes and more.
link_name: 30 Recipes to Make with Fresh Peaches

status_message: "Packed with peanuts and gooey with caramel, this do-ahead treat has an easy cookie crust and scrumptious candy bar layers. It goes together quickly—and will disappear just as fast!" —Taste of Home Test Kitchen
"Color, texture and a fantastic blend of flavors—this salsa has it all. It's easy to adapt to the taste preferences of your family or guests." —Heidi Mitchell, Cornwall, Prince Edward Island

"While broccoli florets and chunks of red pepper give this dish plenty of color, it's the fresh gingerroot, garlic, soy sauce and sesame oil that round out the flavor." —Mary Relyea, Canastota, New York
S'mores can sure get messy. But the messier the s'more—the better it is to eat! Do you have a picture eating your messiest s'more? #NationalSmoresDay is only 4 days away!
"Friends tell me that they like that these are so colorful and pretty, not to mention so wonderful to eat!" —Billie Blanton, Kingsport, Tennessee

"I can remember my Grandma Wheeler making these delicious muffins—we'd eat them nice and warm, fresh from the oven! She was a 'pinch of this' and 'handful of that' kind of cook, so getting the ingredient amounts correct for the recipe was a challenge. Now it's a family treasure!" —Darlis A. Wilfer, West Bend, Wisconsin
"Living in Maine, I am lucky to have an endless amount of wild blueberries. This recipe's similar to a pineapple upside-down cake." —Nettie Moore, Belfast, Maine

"Treasured family recipes like this one become like old friends. These crispy spears have a slightly salty, tart flavor with a good balance of dill, garlic and peppers." —Betty Sitzman, Wray, Colorado

It's cucumber time! Do you like your cucumber salad 1) cool and sour-creamy or 2) bright and vinegary? We gotta know!

Vote in the comments (and tell us how you make it awesome!) and don't forget to include your city and state.

"Mother made these fresh-tasting sloppy joes many times when I was growing up. She passed the recipe on to me when I got married. My brother-in-law says they're the best sandwiches he's ever tasted. And he ought to know—his name is Joe!" —Ellen Stringer, Bourbonnais, Illinois

#NationalSmoresDay is in 5 days! Did you know our favorite summertime treat was originally called "Some More?" It is unknown when the name was shortened to "S'Mores," but recipes for using the longer name are in various Girl Scout publications until at least 1971.

"I love this enchilada recipe because it helps me serve a healthy but tasty meal to my family. Also, zucchini is so plentiful in the garden and this dish makes a great way to use it up." —Angela Leinenbach, Mechanicsville, Virginia

"I love breakfast for dinner, especially this combo of eggs with potatoes and cheese started in a skillet and then popped in the oven to bake. Of course it works for breakfast, too." —Nadine Merheb, Tucson, Arizona

"I asked my grandmother for this recipe after trying these irresistible spice cupcakes at her home. I love their creamy caramel frosting. They're such a scrumptious dessert you actually forget you're eating your vegetables, too!" 
—Virginia LaPierre, Greensboro Bend, Vermont

"We always have way more cucumbers and tomatoes coming out of our garden than we can handle. This is one of the many recipes I found to use them up in a delightful way." —Anna Davis, Half Way, Missouri
"If my family had their wish, I'd serve chicken on the grill every night. This sweet and tangy glaze is an appealing alternative to traditional tomato-based sauces." —Heidi Holmes, Renton, Washington

What's better than classic s'mores? S'mores made with Girl Scout cookies! Try this Taste of Home recipe and be sure to share the final result with us by tagging our page. Only 6 days left until #NationalSmoresDay! http://bit.ly/1IdCq6l

Hey Moms! Our editors are planning their spring issues and want to know...

What do you actually want on Mother's Day morning?
a)    Breakfast in bed
b)    Out for brunch
c)     Me time…just wanna sleep in

Tell us how it really is. Thanks in advance!
—Taste of Home Editors

"We enjoyed a hearty breakfast bake during a visit to an Amish inn. When I asked for the recipe, one of the ladies told me the ingredients right off the top of her head. I modified it to create this version my family loves. Try breakfast sausage in place of bacon." —Beth Notaro, Kokomo, Indiana
"One of my best friends loves chocolate as much as I do, so I like to make this over-the-top treat when we're together playing board games or cards." —Vicki DuBois, Milltown, Indiana

"Whenever I serve this summertime go-to, people can't believe that it's frozen and not fresh. It stays crisp-tender and now I can have "fresh" corn any time of the year." —Judy Oudekerk, St. Michael, Minnesota
"Creamy, flavorful and so easy to fix, this meal-in-one will wow family and friends. Get ready for recipe requests for this easy chicken casserole!" —Laura Kayser, Ankeny, Iowa

The countdown has officially begun! Only one week until Taste of Home celebrates #NationalSmoresDay with Girl Scouts USA! Do you have a secret ingredient that makes everyone ask for s'more?

"Pair a slice of this moist cake with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. It's a staple at our family barbecues." —Rebecca Little, Park Ridge, Illinois

"My family adores this casserole. It's old-timey comfort food." 
—Patricia Lavell, Islamorada, Florida

"I've had an overabundance of zucchini in my garden and I created this recipe to use up some of my bounty. My husband often shies away from vegetable dishes, but he declared this one a winner!" —Barbara Edgington, Frankfort, Ohio
"It's been a tradition at our house to serve this dish. It's especially good during the summer when the cucumbers are fresh-picked from the garden." —Pamela Eaton, Monclova, Ohio
"My friends can barely wait for the growing season to arrive so I can make this incredible relish. The color really dresses up a hot dog." —Ruth Hawkins, Jackson, Mississippi

"A few years ago, I found this zucchini recipe that's quick to prepare and freezes well, too. Just put it in the refrigerator to thaw in the morning and pop it into the oven when you get home!" 
—Karen Howard, Lakeville, Massachusetts

"These funnel cakes are much simpler to make than doughnuts, but taste just as good. They have been a favorite of ours since we came across them living in the Ozarks." —Mary Faith Yoder, Unity, Wisconsin
"Everyone in our family, from smallest kids to oldest adults, loves these hot dogs. They're so easy to throw together in the morning, or even the night before." —Michele Harris, Vicksburg, Michigan

"When friends call to ask me for new recipes to try, I suggest these flavorful fajitas. It's wonderful to put the beef in the slow cooker before church and come home to a hot delicious main dish." —Janie Reitz, Rochester, Minnesota
"You will not believe how fast these disappear. Even confirmed veggie-haters devour these tasty snacks as fast as I can make them!" —Trisha Kruse, Eagle, Idaho

"This recipe evolved from a need to use the bumper crops of cherry tomatoes we grow. It's become a summer favorite, especially at cookouts." 
—Sally Sibley, St. Augustine, Florida

"I look forward to August because our family reunion means fun and great food, like this moist classic cake with the special flair it gets from pineapple. My great-aunt gave me this recipe, and I always make it for the reunion." 
—Victoria Teeter-Casey, Enterprise, Oregon

"This easy-to-prepare tart is a family favorite, fresh out of the oven or at room temperature with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. 
—James Schend, San Francisco, California

"This fruit salad has such a surprising yet fabulous mix of flavors that friends often ask for the recipe. Combine seedless watermelon varieties in yellow, red and pink for a colorful twist." 
—Heidi Haight, Macomb, Michigan

"For these nifty foil packs, small hands make quick work of topping potato wedges with a hot dog, onions and cheese." 
—Kelly Westphal, Wind Lake, Wisconsin

"My husband has a hearty appetite—our two kids never tire of pizza—and I grow lots of zucchini. So this tasty, tomatoey casserole is absolutely tops with us throughout the entire year."  —Lynn Bernstetter, White Bear Lake, Minnesota

Taste of Home is joining Girl Scouts USA to commemorate National S'mores Day on August 10th. We'll be posting some Taste of Home recipes next week and we want to hear your S'mores Lore—stories, images and recipes you have of this classic campfire treat. Check back on Monday to see what's (graham) crackin' on our page! #NationalSmoresDay

"You won't believe the compliments you'll receive when you greet guests with these warm appetizers. Every crispy bite offers the savory tastes of feta cheese, tomatoes, basil and garlic."

Happy National Cheesecake Day! Enjoy these top-rated cheesecake recipes, including this delectable combination of chocolate and raspberry from Mickey Turner in Grants Pass, Oregon.

"No matter what time of year you eat them, these ribs taste like summer. It's feel-good food!" —Ron Bynaker, Lebanon, Pennsylvania

"In summer, I am always looking for ways to use the fresh basil and tomatoes that grow in my herb garden. This recipe combines the two flavors in a wonderful salad!" —Mary Ann Turk, Joplin, Missouri

"A biscuit-textured cinnamon bun with the ease of food processor preparation, this family-friendly breakfast bun is glazed with maple and vanilla flavors to accent the cinnamon and nuts." —Rita Vogel, Malcom, Iowa
"My husband grills this recipe for both breakfast and dinner gatherings. Besides the company, the potatoes are one of the best parts!" —Susan Nordin, Warren, Pennsylvania

"I like to serve fish tacos with quinoa and black beans for a complete and satisfying meal. If you've got them, add colorful summer toppings like bright peppers, green onions or purple carrots." —Camille Parker, Chicago, Illinois
"Juicy blueberries swimming in a sweet jelly taste terrific spooned over vanilla ice cream. But we also enjoy it on top of waffles and pancakes." —Shannon Arthur, Portsmouth, Ohio

"I love that the classic American cookie accidentally got its start when Ruth Wakefield used a Nestle chocolate bar as a substitute for baker's chocolate. The chocolate didn't melt, and the chocolate chip cookie was born. My version—it's big, thick and soft—is based on a recipe from a bakery in California called Hungry Bear." —Irene Yeh, Mequon, Wisconsin

"In Mexico, grilled corn sometimes comes slathered in mayonnaise, rolled in grated cheese and served with lime and chili powder. This is my family's take on the dish, with our own flavor enhancements." —Carolyn Kumpe, El Dorado, California

"Very rich and filling, this easy skillet supper goes together quickly on a busy weeknight. Serve with some cheesy garlic bread."
 —Jan Hollingsworth, Houston, Mississippi
"Spinach salad looks best-dressed when it wears luscious red strawberries and accents of toasted pecans. Finish it out with a sweet poppy seed dressing." —Erin Loughmiller, Ridgecrest, California
link_name: Strawberry Spinach Salad with Poppy Seed Dressing

status_message: "Whenever I make these muffins, I freeze several. As I'm leaving for work in the morning, I pull one out and enjoy it at the office with a cup of coffee." —Janet Pierce DeCori, Rockton, Illinois

"I grill just about everything in the summer to avoid turning on my oven—including this creamy potato salad. My friends have dubbed this 'The Best Potato Salad You'll Ever Put in Your Mouth!'—and I love that!" —Gayle Robinson, Carrolton, Georgia
"We love chicken Parmesan and thought, 'Why not make it a burger?' I like to use fresh mozzarella on these." —Charlotte Gehle, Brownstown, Michigan
"Summer means cooling off with a slice of watermelon and a glass of cold lemonade. This combines two favorites in one." —Darlene Brenden, Salem, Oregon
"'What a flavor!' That's what I hear most often after folks try this pie I invented one day when I was short of peaches for a full crust." —Sue Thumma, Shepherd, Michigan
"These novel knots are handy because they can be made ahead of time and re-heated when needed." —Jane Paschke, University Park, Florida

"We love the perfect blend of sweet and citrus in this refreshing smoothie. It's so easy to throw together, I often find myself making one for breakfast or a midday snack." —Jamie King, Duluth, Minnesota
"These pork chops make a quick company dish. Our family enjoys them on the grill, as the summer weather in our part of the country is hot and muggy." —Blanche Babinski, Minto, North Dakota
"This savory canned sauce is a tomato-grower's dream come true!" —Tonya Branham, Mt. Olive, Alabama
"The first bite of creamy filling lets you know this isn't any old omelet. Make it once, and we suspect you'll be fixing it often." —Anne Troise, Manalapan, New Jersey
"Rhubarb and strawberry often go together, but blueberries give rhubarb a fresh and summery touch." —Mike Schulz, Tawas City, Michigan
"I turn to this recipe when I need something fun and easy for dessert. It's a decadent take on classic campfire s'mores." —Lily Julow, Lawrenceville, Georgia
"A special marinade gives the meat in these fajitas outstanding flavor that's always a hit with my family." —Cheryl Smith, The Dalles, Oregon

"I created this recipe on a family camping trip, when I threw a  hodgepodge of ingredients together in a foil packet. Everyone said that they were delicious. Ever since, I've grilled them at home with equally good results." —Lauri Krause, Jackson, Nebraska

"I've made this jam for many years and no one has been able to guess the secret ingredient. Everyone swears it tastes just like fresh raspberry jam!" —Elizabeth Baker, Birdsboro, Pennsylvania
"My children like this savory barbecue sauce so much, they've been known to hover over me, trying to snitch a spoonful behind my back." —Patricia Parker, Connelly Springs, North Carolina
